security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown guides, example bash scripts in code blocks, and process diagrams. No executable code, no network calls, no file writes. The skill is purely instructional for creating slash commands in Claude Flow.

content.user_title: Create Slash Commands for Claude Flow
content.value_statement: Slash commands provide quick access to micro-skills from the command line. This skill guides you through designing, generating, testing, and deploying custom slash commands with validation and documentation.
actual_capabilities: Design command syntax, parameters, and behavior specifications
Generate command handlers with validation and routing logic
Create test suites for command functionality
Build documentation and help text for commands
Deploy commands to the Claude Flow system
limitations: Requires Claude Flow to be installed
Cannot execute commands on remote systems directly
Commands must follow Claude Flow command schema format
Does not provide AI-generated code beyond templates

use_cases.title: Quick Task Access
use_cases.description: Create shortcuts for frequently used development tasks like testing, building, or deploying code

use_cases.title: Automation Workflows
use_cases.description: Build commands for infrastructure management, deployment pipelines, and system maintenance

use_cases.title: Documentation Commands
use_cases.description: Generate commands that produce documentation, API references, and usage guides

prompt_templates.title: Basic Command
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a /deploy command that deploys the current project to production with a --environment flag

prompt_templates.title: With Parameters
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a /analyze command that accepts a path parameter and validates it exists before processing

prompt_templates.title: Subcommands
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a /git command with subcommands for commit, push, and pull with appropriate parameters for each

prompt_templates.title: Full Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete /test command with handler, tests, documentation, and shell completions for bash

output_examples.input: Create a /analyze command for my codebase
output: Added parameter validation for required 'path' field
Run 'npx claude-flow@alpha command install' to deploy

best_practices: Use clear, descriptive command names that match user expectations
Validate all parameters early and provide helpful error messages
Include usage examples in command documentation
Test commands thoroughly before deployment including error cases
anti_patterns: Creating commands with ambiguous or overlapping names
Skipping parameter validation leading to runtime errors
Deploying without testing edge cases and error scenarios
Missing documentation for command parameters and examples

faq.question: Which tools support these slash commands?
faq.answer: Slash commands work with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code when Claude Flow is installed.

faq.question: What are the performance targets?
faq.answer: Command registration completes in under 100ms, validation in under 50ms, and execution in under 2 seconds.

faq.question: Can I chain multiple commands?
faq.answer: Yes, commands can be chained and subcommands are supported for complex workflows.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill only generates command templates locally. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: Commands are not working after installation
faq.answer: Run 'npx claude-flow@alpha command registry update' and verify installation with 'command list --installed'.

faq.question: How does this compare to shell aliases?
faq.answer: Slash commands integrate with Claude Flow for AI-assisted execution, support parameters, validation, and auto-discovery beyond basic shell aliases.
